'I needed to escape and I was willing to make amends later, when I would come back to tear this whole kingdom apart, after they had already killed it with their business.'

'I bided my time until I found a moment to escape. 

'And there it was.' 

'I could steal a mecha-horse from the stables and I figured could make a great distance towards the nearest town to get help. Not all the way though. So my only hope was with running into someone on the road before they realized what I had done and caught up.'

'I went in the cover of night, made sure the men had eaten all their fill, and were deep in slumber.'

'I grabbed the horse, and was as quiet as I could be. Every sound I made could've given me away, every sound I heard could've been someone coming to prevent me from getting away ever again.'

'But I made it past the gates and broke the horse into a sprint to get as far away from this horrid castle as possible.'

[[And then...?]]

passages.name: And then...?
passages.text:
'I ran into a soldier who lived in a cottage nearby with a comm link to the King's Guard and he promised to protect me.'

'I suspected he might've secretly been working for //them//. So many times I had been burnt by the faith of corrupt men, but I had no other choice.'

'And I chose right.'

[[It worked out?!]]

passages.name: It worked out?!
passages.text:
'He called the King's Guard and they came to the castle to free all the princesses.'

'I was hailed as a heroine. They said I was so brave.'

'But, honestly, I felt I didn't deserve any honor higher than the other women who had suffered and //weren't// able to escape.'

'Still, I used my platform as an opportunity to save other princesses. To bring more awareness to our plight.'

'Eventually, I found a prince who was impressed with my ingenuity and resolve and we married.'

[[Was it happily ever after?]]

passages.name: Was it happily ever after?
passages.text:
'Like all stories, it hardly ever turns out that way.'

'For years, I wouldn't trust men. Just the sound of a man's voice would sometimes be enough to make me shudder and cry.'

//She looks at you.//

'Even my own husband's.'

//She continues.//

'Even when a prisoner is already freed, sometimes a prisoner is still captive in their heart.'

'But still, I pressed on in my work to save more princesses from adventurers' insatiable appetites.'

'That's why I'm in this castle. To tell others about my story, so they may learn from it.'

'But to answer as to whether there was a happily ever after. There //was// one memory I had where I felt I was finally free.'

[[What was that memory?]]

passages.name: What was that memory?
passages.text:
'I was with my prince and our children. We were by a cabin by a lake meant only for us. The royal wizards had cast a protection ward so not a soul would be able to bother us.'

'As I swam in the waters, it reminded me of the lake I would swim in when I was growing up. The cool waters holding me up as I floated, making my hair wet and thin.'

'I remembered back to when I was a little girl who didn't worry about being beautiful. And my body was mine and mine alone and I could be as bold and angry and silly as I wanted to be with it without worrying about anyone saying a word.'

'And I thought about how I was finally free again, as if I were back to being that carefree child. And my prince was strong and handsome and respectful. And my children were beautiful. And my body had these beautiful scars from giving birth to them and my prince didn't care and I didn't care.'

'And for a moment, I felt my body was mine again.'
